title: Nemotron 3 Nano Technical Report
summary:
This particular model release is interesting because not only is it open weights[0], but they also released most of the pretraining and posttraining data along with the code and libraries for the RL environments (much like Olmo3, which came out recently). It is also trained from scratch and architecturally different from the existing Qwen and DeepSeek templates. It is frontier performance for its weight class. Two larger model releases are to follow soon.

[0] Not exactly open source, though—it's Nvidia Open Model License.

Comments
content:
This particular model release is interesting because not only is it open weights[0], but they also released most of the pretraining and posttraining data along with the code and libraries for the RL environments (much like Olmo3, which came out recently). Two larger model releases are to follow soon.

content:
Human Resources is an area in many organisations where AI can have significant operational impact. The technology is now being embedded into day-to-day operations, in activities like answering employees’ questions and supporting training. The clearest impact appears where organisations can measure the tech’s outcomes, typically in time saved and the numbers of queries successfully resolved. […]

The post AI in Human Resources: the real operational impact appeared first on AI News.

title: Roblox brings AI into the Studio to speed up game creation
summary:
Roblox is often seen as a games platform, but its day-to-day reality looks closer to a production studio. Small teams release new experiences on a rolling basis and then monetise them at scale. That pace creates two persistent problems: time lost to repeatable production work, and friction when moving outputs between tools. Roblox’s 2025 updates […]
